readingAndWriting

Class ReadingAndWriting

  • java.lang.Object
    • readingAndWriting.ReadingAndWriting

  • public class ReadingAndWriting
extends java.lang.Object

    Reading and Writing

    class to take in file inputs from a user and use them in three separate ways:
    1 - check to see if a file's braces are balanced
    2 - check to see if two files are identical
    3 - fill in a short story using a provided file of words and/or user input
    Since:
    September 18, 2017
    Author:
    Braden Hoagland

      • createInputFile

        public static java.util.Scanner createInputFile(java.lang.String inputFileName,
                                                int part)
        method that determines if an input file given by the user exists, and returns a Scanner for that file if it does
        Parameters:
        inputFileName - the name of the input file given by the user
        part - the current part of the program (either 1 for braces, 2 for identity, or 3 for short story)
        Returns:
        the Scanner to be used to parse the input file

      • createInputFile

        public static java.util.Scanner[] createInputFile(java.lang.String inputFileName1,
                                                  java.lang.String inputFileName2,
                                                  int part)
        method that determines if two input files given by the user exist, and returns an array of Scanners - one for each file - if they do
        Parameters:
        inputFileName1 - the name of the first input file given by the user
        inputFileName2 - the name of the second input file given by the user
        part - (either 1 for braces, 2 for identity, or 3 for short story)
        Returns:
        the array of Scanners to be used to parse the input file

        public static java.lang.String checkBraces(java.lang.String fileName)
        checks to see if a given file's braces are balanced
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the input file given by the user
        Returns:
        a String stating whether or not the braces in the file are balanced

                                              java.lang.String fileName2)
        checks if two given files are identical
        Parameters:
        fileName1 - the name of the first input file given by the user
        fileName2 - the name of the second input file given by the user
        Returns:
        a String stating whether or not the given files are identical

      • getShortStoryWordsFromUser

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getShortStoryWordsFromUser(int wordsLeft,
                                                                               java.lang.String fileName)
        gets a list of words from the user to fill the short story
        Parameters:
        wordsLeft - the number of words for the short story already given in a separate file. This method takes those into account and fills out any that are remaining
        fileName - the name of the short story file given by the user
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of the words to be used in the short story

      • getShortStoryWordsFromFile

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getShortStoryWordsFromFile(java.util.Scanner scanner)
        gets a list of words from a file to fill the short story
        Parameters:
        scanner - the Scanner for the input file of short story words
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of words to be used in the short story

      • fillShortStory

        public static void fillShortStory(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> words,
                                  java.lang.String fileName)
        fill in the short story using a given list of words
        Parameters:
        words - an ArrayList of words to be used in the short story
        fileName - the name of the short story file given by the user

      • part1

        public static void part1(java.lang.String[] args)
        checks if braces are balanced
        Parameters:
        args - a String[] of length 1 containing the file to be checked

      • part2

        public static void part2(java.lang.String[] args)
        checks if two files are identical
        Parameters:
        args - a String[] of length 2 containing the two files to be compared

      • part3

        public static void part3(java.lang.String[] args)
        fills out a short story using user input
        Parameters:
        args - a String[] of length 3 containing the two files for parts one and two and one other file with the short story template

      • part4

        public static void part4(java.lang.String[] args)
        fills out a short story using a list of words and/or user input
        Parameters:
        args - a String[] of length 4 containing the two files for parts one and two, another file with the short story template, and one other file with provided words for the short story
